brandcolor-primary.usage: Main CTA button background, primary brand color

brandcolor-primaryhover.usage: Hover state for primary buttons (when background is primary)
whenToUse: Hover on elements with primary background
examples: Full primary button: bg-brandcolor-primary text-brandcolor-white hover:bg-brandcolor-primaryhover
brandcolor-primaryhover.logic: When a button or element has bg-brandcolor-primary, the hover should use bg-brandcolor-primaryhover (darker shade of primary)

brandcolor-secondary.usage: Secondary brand color for outline/secondary buttons with border
examples: Outline button: border-brandcolor-secondary text-brandcolor-secondary bg-transparent hover:bg-brandcolor-secondaryhover

brandcolor-secondaryhover.usage: Hover state for secondary/outline buttons (NOT bg-brandcolor-fill)
whenToUse: Hover on elements with secondary/outline style
examples: Full outline button: border-brandcolor-secondary text-brandcolor-secondary bg-transparent hover:bg-brandcolor-secondaryhover
brandcolor-secondaryhover.logic: When a button is secondary (outline style with border), the hover should use bg-brandcolor-secondaryhover (#EFEFEF), NOT bg-brandcolor-fill. This is a lighter gray specifically for secondary button hovers.

brandcolor-textstrong.usage: Headings, main headings, button text in some cases

brandcolor-textweak.usage: Secondary text, secondary hierarchy after main text

brandcolor-strokestrong.usage: ALWAYS use for: Sidebar borders, input field borders, button borders, icons
brandcolor-strokestrong.importantNote: ALWAYS use strokestrong for sidebar borders, input field borders, and button borders. This is a mandatory rule.

brandcolor-strokeweak.usage: ALWAYS use for: Card borders, dividers, and all other light elements
whenToUse: Secondary button borders (ALL secondary buttons use this border color - exception to button border rule)
brandcolor-strokeweak.importantNote: ALWAYS use strokeweak for card borders and dividers. Secondary buttons are an exception and also use strokeweak, but all other button borders use strokestrong.

brandcolor-fill.usage: Layout background (NOT for secondary button hover - use brandcolor-secondaryhover instead)
brandcolor-fill.importantNote: DO NOT use this for secondary button hover - use brandcolor-secondaryhover (#EFEFEF) instead

brandcolor-white.usage: Background color in general wherever necessary

primary.description: Main CTA button with primary brand color
primary.logic: Uses primary brand color as background with white text. On hover, background changes to brandcolor-primaryhover (#016323) which is a darker shade of primary for better visual feedback.

secondary.description: Secondary button WITH brand secondary color (Type 1)
secondary.logic: Transparent background with brandcolor-strokeweak border (#DDDDDD) and brandcolor-secondary text (#2F55D9). On hover, background fills with brandcolor-secondaryhover (#EFEFEF). IMPORTANT: Border is ALWAYS brandcolor-strokeweak, NOT brandcolor-secondary.
secondary.whenToUse: Use when you want the button to have the secondary brand color as text

secondary-outline.description: Secondary button WITHOUT brand secondary color (Type 2)
secondary-outline.logic: Transparent background with brandcolor-strokeweak border (#DDDDDD) and brandcolor-textstrong text (#001A31). On hover, background fills with brandcolor-secondaryhover (#EFEFEF). IMPORTANT: Border is ALWAYS brandcolor-strokeweak, text is strong text color.
secondary-outline.whenToUse: Use when you want a secondary button style but with strong text color instead of secondary brand color

outline.description: Outline button with strong stroke (alternative outline style)
outline.logic: Transparent with strong stroke border (#737373). Hover uses brandcolor-secondaryhover (#EFEFEF). This is different from secondary buttons which use brandcolor-strokeweak border.

input.logic: Strong stroke border by default, changes to primary on focus

h1.logic: Strong text color for main headings

h2.logic: Strong text color for secondary headings

h3.logic: Strong text color for tertiary headings

icon.logic: Icons should use strong stroke color for visibility

sidebar.description: Sidebar borders always use strong stroke
sidebar.logic: Sidebar borders MUST use strokestrong for visibility and definition

card.description: Card borders always use weak stroke
card.logic: Card borders MUST use strokeweak for subtle, light appearance

workflow: 1. Read tailwind.config.js to see available theme colors
2. Read this JSON file to understand color usage rules
3. When creating components, follow the guidelines in componentGuidelines
4. Always use theme colors from tailwind config, never hardcode hex values
5. Follow the logic explained in each component guideline
6. Combine utility classes as shown in examples

noHexCodes.rule: NEVER use hex color codes (#008B31, #2F55D9, etc.) directly in HTML, CSS, or inline styles
noHexCodes.reason: All colors must come from theme utility classes for consistency and maintainability

noInlineStyles.rule: NEVER use inline styles (style='color: #008B31') or style attributes for colors
noInlineStyles.reason: All styling must use Tailwind utility classes from the theme system

noHardcodedTailwindColors.rule: NEVER use hardcoded Tailwind color classes (bg-blue-700, text-gray-900, border-gray-200, etc.)
noHardcodedTailwindColors.reason: Always use theme utility classes (bg-brandcolor-primary, text-brandcolor-textstrong, etc.)

onlyUtilityClasses.rule: ONLY use utility classes from theme-guide.json and tailwind.config.js
onlyUtilityClasses.reason: This ensures consistency, maintainability, and easy theme updates
allowed: Tailwind utility classes from theme (bg-brandcolor-*, text-brandcolor-*, border-brandcolor-*)
Standard Tailwind utilities (px-*, py-*, rounded-*, flex, grid, etc.)
Layout and spacing utilities (container, mx-auto, mb-*, gap-*, etc.)
forbidden: Hex codes in any form (#008B31, #2F55D9, etc.)
CSS variables in inline styles (style='color: var(--brand-color)')
Any color values not defined in tailwind.config.js

rules: CRITICAL: NEVER hardcode hex colors (#008B31, #2F55D9, etc.) - ALWAYS use Tailwind utility classes
CRITICAL: NEVER use inline styles (style='...') for colors - ALWAYS use utility classes

CRITICAL: NEVER use hardcoded Tailwind color classes (bg-blue-700, text-gray-900, border-gray-200) - ALWAYS use theme utility classes (bg-brandcolor-primary, text-brandcolor-textstrong, border-brandcolor-strokeweak)
ONLY use utility classes from theme-guide.json and tailwind.config.js
Primary buttons: bg-brandcolor-primary + text-brandcolor-white + hover:bg-brandcolor-primaryhover
Secondary buttons Type 1 (with brand color): border-brandcolor-strokeweak + text-brandcolor-secondary + hover:bg-brandcolor-secondaryhover
Secondary buttons Type 2 (without brand color): border-brandcolor-strokeweak + text-brandcolor-textstrong + hover:bg-brandcolor-secondaryhover
IMPORTANT: ALL secondary buttons use border-brandcolor-strokeweak (#DDDDDD) for border, NOT border-brandcolor-secondary
Headings: Always use text-brandcolor-textstrong
Body text: Use text-brandcolor-textweak
BORDER RULES - CRITICAL:
Sidebar borders: ALWAYS use border-brandcolor-strokestrong
Input field borders: ALWAYS use border-brandcolor-strokestrong
Button borders: ALWAYS use border-brandcolor-strokestrong (EXCEPT secondary buttons which use strokeweak)
Card borders: ALWAYS use border-brandcolor-strokeweak
Dividers: ALWAYS use border-brandcolor-strokeweak
Icons: Always use text-brandcolor-strokestrong
Layout backgrounds: Use bg-brandcolor-fill
Secondary button hover: ALWAYS use bg-brandcolor-secondaryhover (#EFEFEF), NEVER use bg-brandcolor-fill
Primary button hover: ALWAYS use bg-brandcolor-primaryhover (#016323)

importantNotes.primaryButtonHover: When bg is brandcolor-primary, hover MUST be bg-brandcolor-primaryhover (#016323)
importantNotes.secondaryButtonHover: When button is secondary/outline, hover MUST be bg-brandcolor-secondaryhover (#EFEFEF), NOT bg-brandcolor-fill
importantNotes.secondaryButtonBorder: ALL secondary buttons (both types) MUST use border-brandcolor-strokeweak (#C5C5C5), NEVER border-brandcolor-secondary. This is an EXCEPTION to the button border rule.
importantNotes.secondaryButtonTypes: Two types of secondary buttons: (1) text-brandcolor-secondary with brandcolor-strokeweak border, (2) text-brandcolor-textstrong with brandcolor-strokeweak border

borderUsageRules.strokestrong: ALWAYS use for: Sidebar borders, input field borders, button borders (except secondary buttons)
borderUsageRules.strokeweak: ALWAYS use for: Card borders, dividers, and all other light elements. Also used for secondary button borders (exception).

beforeCreatingComponent: Check: Are there any hex codes (#008B31, etc.)? REMOVE them, use utility classes
Check: Are there any inline styles? REMOVE them, use utility classes
Check: Are there hardcoded Tailwind colors (bg-blue-700, text-gray-900)? REPLACE with theme classes
Verify: All colors come from tailwind.config.js theme colors
Verify: All color usage follows theme-guide.json rules

validationChecklist.hexCodes: NO hex codes anywhere in component
validationChecklist.inlineStyles: NO inline style attributes for colors
validationChecklist.hardcodedColors: NO hardcoded Tailwind color classes (bg-blue-*, text-gray-*, etc.)
validationChecklist.themeClassesOnly: YES - Only theme utility classes (bg-brandcolor-*, text-brandcolor-*, border-brandcolor-*)
validationChecklist.standardUtilities: YES - Standard Tailwind utilities (px-*, py-*, rounded-*, flex, grid) are allowed
